ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: The Actor and the Text: Othello is essentially like getting credit for being in an amazing production. The only work involved two papers and the performance itself, which was awesome and very refreshing. I would definitely recommend this class, but really any Actor and the Text class (this was my 2nd) is amazing.

Murray Biggs is a fantastic director, even though sometimes his specificity in direction could be a bit cumbersome. The product was stunning though, as a result, and the play was one of the best productions this year. You learn a lot about acting, and not much about anything else. It is truly an ACTOR and the TEXT course, which was what I signed up for.
I think these sorts of classes vary wildly depending on the teacher/play but this was great it was basically getting credit for doing a show
Great experience to work with a professional director outside of the Dramat.
"Actor and the Text" class is worthwhile for any serious undergrad actor. Professor Biggs knows his stuff on shakespeare language and text.
